revised_title: Exact Form and Motion of Waves in Deep Water
tldr: The author, W. J. Macquorn Rankine, investigates the exact form and motion of waves in deep water. He proves that the theory of rolling waves can be applied to all types of displacements, not just small ones. He also explains that the surfaces of equal pressure, including the upper surface, are trochoidal in shape. Additionally, he discusses the mechanical energy of waves, the difference between the elevation of crests and the depression of hollows, and the hydrostatic pressure at each particle during wave motion.
